intro: Uvifera zebra, commonly known as the zebra plant, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, variegated leaves that feature alternating green and white stripes, resembling a zebra's coat. Native to South Africa, this plant thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight. It produces small, fragrant white flowers during the summer months. The plant is relatively low maintenance, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
